articles.title: Netflix earnings bring big subscriber windfall, but stock gets dinged on light revenue forecast
articles.content: Netflix Inc. wowed Wall Street with 5.9 million new subscribers Wednesday, but lighter-than-expected revenue and sales projections undercut the company's stock in extended trading.

articles.title: Handling a Raging Bull Market (5 Tips)
articles.content: In a raging bull market, investors best serve themselves by exuding patience, managing emotions, and implementing common-sense measures. Strategist Andrew Rocco provides 5 timely tips.

articles.title: ‘I used to work at Nvidia. The stock I got is now half my portfolio. Should I sell?’
articles.content: Having a large share of your wealth in one stock -- especially your employer's stock -- is very risky.

articles.title: Did Apple Say The Magic Words 'Apple GPT'? Why The Tech Stock Is Ripping Wednesday
articles.content:
Apple Inc (NASDAQ: AAPL) stock is trading higher Wednesday as reports indicate the company is quietly working on artificial intelligence tools that could challenge those of OpenAI Inc, Alphabet Inc’s (NASDAQ: GOOG) (NASDAQ: GOOGL) Google, and others.
It has built its framework to create large language models or the AI-based systems at the heart of new offerings like ChatGPT and Google’s Bard, Bloomberg reports, citing familiar sources.
With that foundation, known as “Ajax,” Apple also has created a chatbot service that some engineers call “Apple GPT.”

articles.title: Apple Analyst Expects Stock To Hit $210 On 2024 Earnings Projections, iPhone Delay
articles.content:
Shares of Apple Inc (NASDAQ: AAPL) remained under pressure in early trading on Wednesday, despite the company gaining market share in the second quarter.
Weak demand and a potential delay in the launch of iPhone 15A could result in lower iPhone sales than was earlier anticipated, according to BofA Securities.
The Apple Analyst: Wamsi Mohan reiterated a Neutral rating, while raising the price objective from $190 to $210.
Check out other analyst stock ratings.

articles.title: Goldman Sachs’s stock turns higher as bank sees potential uptick in deal making after ‘noisy’ second-quarter results
articles.content: The bank booked a $504 million impairment related to its GreenSky consumer-banking unit and $485 million related to consolidated real-estate investments.

articles.title: 4 Stocks to Watch as Back-to-School Shopping Promises Growth
articles.content: The back-to-school sales are expected to grow 12.5% this year, helping stocks like Apple, Inc. (AAPL), HP Inc. (HPQ), PC Connection, Inc. (CNXN) and Casey's General Stores, Inc. (CASY).
